title: (x) "épicerie fine" upright connected script - French Script {Stephen, Patricia}
content:
[Do you know this Scriptfont?](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808063109/http:/www.luftzentrale.de/tmp/script-epicerie-fine.jpg)  
(It’s not _LinoScript_ or _Typo Upright_)

Regards

 [‹ (x) Delicity Sweet House serif face - Times {Patricia}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808063109/http:/typophile.com/node/19712 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) small sans serif gif with little to go on - Frutiger {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808063109/http:/typophile.com/node/19706 "Go to next forum topic")
author: poms

comments.content:
I think it is Typo Upright rather nicely adjusted to allow a vinyl cutter to cut it out.  
However, I have been wrong in the past:)  
Tim

Typo Upright is similar, but It’s probably [French Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808063109/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=C.6428.5.4&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=%C3%A9picerie+fine&sampleSize=48) with an improved accent.
Patty, if you go to purchase options you’ll see that French Script is not purchasable from MyFonts. They don’t sell most Monotype fonts.
Stephen - I BUY my fonts from Fontshop but for this forum I prefer myfonts because of the keyword search. It’s also faster to load and cleaner for viewing the fonts.

Keyword Search: Indeed. This makes MyFonts a great resource. We’ll be adding keyword search in the next update.

Speed: Good to know. We’re making speed a priority in our improvements.

Cleaner: Can you explain? Your input is helpful as I know you visit all the resellers.

Stephen - while your site has a more sophisticated design, there is a lot of visual noise, all that yellow and copy boxing everything in. When you look at a sample on myfonts it’s surrounded by white. Also they don’t put those lines behind the fonts as often. I understand why they are there - copyright protection - but still it makes the font harder to view. So when I’m doing a quick font search or just want to look at a sample (unless I have the font and can look at it in my font software) I tend to go to myfonts.

I hope that helps. Like I said, I do my shopping at your site.

(I’ll add that one of the things that bugs me about myfonts is that when you click on the f ont they take you to the “font sample” the cascade, rather than the test drive or the character map which would be more useful.
